name: Moschus
Relationship: Antidotes: CAMPH.; COFF.Compare: NUX MOSCH.; ASAF.; VALER.; SUMBUL.; IGN.; CASTOR.Compatible: AMBRA.

Head: Pressure on top of head
Compressive pain over root of nose
Scalp sensitive
Vertigo on least motion; sensation as if falling from a great height
Sounds in ears as from the report of a cannon
Respiratory: Tightness of chest, is obliged to take a deeper breath
Sudden constriction of larynx and trachea
Difficult respiration; chest oppressed; hysterical spasm of chest; asthma
Cough ceases, mucus cannot be expectorated
Asthma, with intense anxiety, fear, and smothering sensation
Stomach: With stomach symptoms, anxiety in chest
Mind: Anxiety, with palpitation; starting as if frightened
Female: Drawing and pushing in the direction of the genitals; sensation as if menses appear
Menses too early, too profuse, with disposition to faint
Sexual desire, with intolerable titillation in parts

details: A remedy for hysteria and nervous paroxysms, FAINTING FITS and convulsions, catalepsy, etc. The characteristic condition begin aggravation by cold; there is great sensitiveness to air. Much nervous trembling and frequent fainting. Great flatulence. Diseases do not follow a normal course. COLDNESS. Tension in muscles, skin and mind.
